Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery kernos; white slip; on bottom, band of tongues between brown lines; on exterior, black-figure decoration consisting of figure in long added red cloak to right; at left, foot of another figure; interior, reserved above black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Humans are very rarely featured on Sphinx and Lion Style vases, and as far as is known, there are no female figures. While it is impossible to identify the figure on this sherd, there is no reason to eliminate the possibility that it is a female.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2192) (phase 2)
